ideaBrowser.note: IdeaBrowser.com blocked by Vercel security checkpoint — unable to scrape today's idea.

forgeLabs.name: AI Governance Readiness Scorecard (Teams App)
forgeLabs.problem: 48% of hospitals aren't operationally ready for AI at scale (Guidehouse-HIMSS Feb 2026). CIOs need a fast self-assessment tool — not a 6-month consulting engagement — to identify governance gaps before Joint Commission/CHAI audits start.
forgeLabs.solution: A lightweight Microsoft Teams app that walks hospital leaders through the 7 CHAI governance pillars with scored questions, generates a readiness scorecard PDF, benchmarks against anonymized peer data, and flags priority gaps with remediation steps.
forgeLabs.moat: FORGE's deep CHAI/NIST AI RMF expertise baked into scoring logic. Benchmarking data grows with usage (network effect). First-mover in Teams App Store for healthcare AI governance.
forgeLabs.dataSource: Joint Commission-CHAI framework (public), NIST AI RMF (public), state AI law tracker (public regulatory feeds), anonymized aggregate scores from users.
forgeLabs.competitionCheck: No healthcare AI governance self-assessment in Teams App Store. Compliance tools exist (Vanta, Drata) but none healthcare-AI-specific. Consulting firms charge $50K+ for what this does in 20 minutes.
forgeLabs.buildTime: 2-3 nights — questionnaire logic + PDF generation + Teams manifest
forgeLabs.deployTo: Microsoft Teams App Store (primary), Azure Marketplace, web standalone
forgeLabs.monetization: Free tier: 1 assessment/quarter. Pro: $49/org/month (unlimited assessments, benchmarking, remediation playbooks). Enterprise: custom.
forgeLabs.whyNow: Joint Commission-CHAI voluntary certification coming later 2026. Hospitals will scramble to self-assess before audits begin. First-mover window is NOW.

articles.title: Survey: Nearly 50% of Hospitals Aren't Ready to Implement AI at Scale
articles.takeaway: 78% of health systems have AI projects but only 52% feel operationally ready. 'Execution paralysis' is the top barrier — exactly what FORGE's Activation Bridge solves.
articles.linkedInAngle: Share the stat, ask: 'Is your health system in the 48% that aren't ready? Here's what execution paralysis actually looks like — and how to break through it.'

articles.title: The AI Wild West Is Over: Why 2026 Is the Year Health Systems Must Take Control
articles.takeaway: 71% of US hospitals have AI but fragmented data, siloed pilots, and limited governance are the blockers. Premier says move from experimentation to enterprise-wide foundation — LUMEN SDK fits this narrative perfectly.
articles.linkedInAngle: Quote the 'wild west' framing. Position: 'Governance at runtime isn't optional anymore. The hospitals that build decision assurance into their AI pipeline now will be the ones still standing when audits come.'

articles.title: Healthcare AI Regulation: New Compliance Requirements Every Provider Must Know
articles.takeaway: Joint Commission + CHAI released 7-pillar AI governance framework. Most medical AI is never reviewed by any regulator. Voluntary certification program coming later 2026. States creating patchwork laws (CA, TX, CO, NY).
articles.linkedInAngle: Focus on the regulatory gap: 'Most clinical AI is never reviewed by a federal regulator. The Joint Commission just told you what good governance looks like — 7 pillars. How many does your organization cover?'

linkedInPulse.note: Search returned general trends rather than specific LinkedIn posts. Key voices to watch: Cleveland Clinic CDO on AI scribes, Guidehouse healthcare AI leads on execution paralysis findings, Premier Inc leadership on 'wild west' governance narrative.
linkedInPulse.suggestedAction: Engage with Guidehouse-HIMSS survey posts — comment with FORGE's Activation Bridge perspective on execution paralysis.

events.name: HIMSS Global Health Conference 2026 (HIMSS26)
events.relevance: 25,000+ attendees, AI governance track, CIO networking. Top priority for FORGE visibility.
events.action: Register if not already. Plan CIO meeting targets.

events.name: Becker's AI Summit 2026
events.location: Chicago, IL (part of 16th Annual Meeting Apr 13-16)
events.relevance: Executive strategy focus, peer-to-peer format. Real-world AI adoption case studies.
events.action: Strong fit for Activation Bridge conversations.

events.name: AI for Hospitals & Health Plans Summit
events.location: New Orleans, LA (The Roosevelt, Waldorf Astoria)
events.relevance: Smaller, intimate. Clinical decision support + predictive analytics focus. Direct buyer audience.

mindset.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now. — Chinese Proverb
mindset.reflection: Sean — today you walk into OVH with 9 people in the room who are about to see what healthcare AI activation actually looks like. Not slides. Not theory. A working prototype with scenarios built for THEIR ED. 20 years of healthcare tech experience put you in this room. FORGE is the tree. Today you water it.
